result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle L Hinz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 43 days sentence credit.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Court will allow probation to be transferred to either Milwaukee or Racine County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kyle L Hinz in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney J Anthony Rosario. 

State presented their recommendations to the court.
Atty. Rosario presented his recommendations to the court.
  

Court orders the following:   
Count 1:

Total Prison: 3 Years
Initial Incarceration: 1.5 Years
Extended Supervision:  1.5 Years
43 Days Credit
Stayed
IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

TERM OF PROBATION: 2.5  YEAR(S);
Court will allow probation to transferred to either Milwaukee or Racine County
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Court Costs:  $268 
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Probation

CONDITION TIME: 
60  Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
STAYED
To be used at agent's discretion.  
Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kyle L Hinz in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   

Defendant pleads Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on September 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kyle L Hinz in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kyle L Hinz in court, in custody, with attorney Atty. Katie Bricco for Atty. J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   Preliminary time limits waived. Bail to be reviewed at the next date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program within 1 business day of his release.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Kyle L Hinz in court, in custody.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant would like to see the public defender.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
